title: Drawing, 1790–1800
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, graphite, on paper
markings: Recto and Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: The tent is partitioned into three sections by posts. The front section is lit by a lantern suspended from the ceiling. Inside this section, there is a circular medallion supported by two winged figures, just below the ceiling. In the background, behind the tent, a woman sits in the corner of the sofa, against the rear wall.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1790–1800.
1790–1800. Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, graphite, on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1525.
